definition: to dig out/to pick out (with one's fingers)/to carve/to cut/to study meticulously/to lift one's clothes/stingy/miserly
"hand" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 64), occurring in 提, 把, 打 etc
to be fastidious about phrasing, diction, or choice of words
erhua variant of 摳字眼|抠字眼[kou1 zi4 yan3]
to scratch one's foot/(fig.) to be stingy/(slang) (of a celebrity) to twiddle one's thumbs (i.e. not release any new material etc)

sentences.english: You never know what they're looking for in terms of censorship.
sentences.chinese: 你永遠也摸不清他們按照檢查制度所摳的東西是什麼。

sentences.english: Are you going to continue to penny-pinch on teachers' pay?
sentences.chinese: 你還要繼續在老師的工資上一分一分的摳嗎？

sentences.english: The dog picked the bone clean.
Never scrunch up or grip the floor with your toes in any of the standing poses.
sentences.chinese: 在任何站姿體式裏都不要用腳蜷縮或者緊摳地板。

sentences.english: He also discusses how to shoot good footage for keying and how to export the results.
sentences.chinese: 他還講解了如何爲摳像拍攝好的鏡頭及如何導出結果。

sentences.english: Mechanically he reached for the empty gun, drew a bead, and pulled the trigger.
sentences.chinese: 他機械地抓起了那支空槍，瞄好準星，摳下板機。

sentences.english: If I’ve got a cold, I take a non-drowsy decongestant medication in the morning – so I’m not blowing my nose all day – but then don’t take anything in the evening
sentences.chinese: 所以不會整天摳鼻子，但是然後晚上不會做任何事情。

sentences.english: You needn't puzzle over every single word or phrase in the book.
sentences.chinese: 這本書用不着一字一句地摳。

sentences.english: I grab George'sarm and dig my nails into his flesh.
sentences.chinese: 我抓住喬治的胳膊，指甲摳進了他的肉裏。

sentences.english: He picked out the things that had fallen into the hole.
sentences.chinese: 他把掉在洞裏的東西摳了出來。

sentences.english: Machine suitable to mill lasted shoe with sole, and heel already applied. Suitable for every type lf work and for every materials.
sentences.chinese: 此款粗摳邊機可用於打磨釘有鞋跟的各種材質的大底。

sentences.english: In order to matting image, that is to separate the foreground and background.
sentences.chinese: 實現圖像的摳圖功能，即把前景和背景分開。

definition: to draw towards oneself/to gather/to gather up (one's gown, sleeves etc)/to grab (money)/to extort
to hug/to embrace/to hold in one's arms
tongue/CL:個|个[ge4]/enemy soldier captured for the purpose of extracting information
confused/dizzy/giddy/to faint/to swoon/to lose consciousness/to pass out
to wind around/to wrap round/to coil/tangle/to involve/to bother/to annoy
to choke (because of swallowing the wrong way)
to irritate the nose/to choke (of smoke, smell etc)/pungent/(coll.) (Tw) to shout at sb/to scold/to speak out against sb
